abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column observes although hedge funds have significantly underperformed a mix of stock index funds over 10 years, big investors are still dumping money into them, with $1 billion added in January; notes total hedge fund assets are over $3 trillion; points out funds promise to offer higher returns with lower risk, or zero risk.
lead_paragraph: Despite their performance record, the promise of higher returns with lower risk — or even zero risk — beckons.

headline.main: As Hedge Fund Returns Falter, Money Continues to Flow In
headline.print_headline: As Hedge Fund Returns Falter, Money Continues to Flow In

snippet: Despite their performance record, the promise of higher returns with lower risk — or even zero risk — beckons.
